node.name: Yisu Zheng
node.about: New to the design world, wish to explore more possibilities of design! Also hit me up for the best photo spots on campus <3

node.name: April Ye
node.about: When I'm not at Zeus or Starbucks, you can find me either meticulously brewing coffee or stir-frying the same noodle recipe for a year and counting. I love indulging in dating shows or haul videos while eating noodles, and have recently discovered a passion for making green smoothies!

node.name: Yuchang Zhou
node.about: I enjoy creation, especially the process of realizing one crazy idea. As both developer and designer I am actively involved in projects that develop cool products -- mobile apps, web apps, online game, etc. I have been a freelance illustrator since my entry to college and have recently collaborated with my favorite pop singer's concert team! I also design for Cornell Chinese Drama Society, Association of Computer Science Undergraduates, Cornell University Sustainable Design and some school magazines.

node.name: Aiden Yeonsuk Kim
node.about: I'm a Product Designer currently studying Information Science at Cornell University. I became more involved in design after taking a course at Cornell called "Designing Technology for Social Impact." I love solving problems, coming up with awesome solutions, then sometimes discovering I was wrong, and going back to the beginning to solve the issue from a new perspective.

node.name: Ying Yang
node.about: I’m a sophomore majoring in ISST. As a part of DTI, I want to create new solutions that solve social issues for long-lasting impact. On-campus, I’m also a member of Cornell Cup Robotics, ACSU, and CSA. Outside of school, I love singing, exploring new music, searching for new fashion trends, and photography!

node.name: Chelsea Wang
node.about: I love designing and I am a huge fan of Fine Art Photography. My favorite photographers are Richard Rinaldi, Leslie Zhang, and Solomon Mortimer.I love old stuff, such as movies, photos, clothes and songs.

node.name: Michelle Park
node.about:
Hello! My name is Michelle Park and I believe there is power in digital experiences that are designed for humans, by a human.

I was born in South Korea, spent my childhood in both Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City of Vietnam, and then grew up in Irvine, California. I believe that my experiences in growing up in different environments shaped me into the empathetic and fast-adapting person I am today.

 I'm currently a senior at Cornell University studying Information Science with concentration on User Experience (UX). This past summer I designed at Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices working on multiple projects in healthcare technology.

node.name: Yvonne Chan
node.about: I love working on problems to make a positive social impact on communities around me. DTI allows me to do this while working with amazing people and developing my skillset as a designer, developer, and product manager. Outside of DTI, I also get to do what I love by dancing on the Assorted Aces Dance Team and organizing events for the Product Management Club. When I'm not working in eHub, I'm discovering new music, journaling, and exploring Ithaca with friends!

node.name: Yuxuan Chen
node.about: Hi, I’m Yuxuan! I am a product designer who is passionate about making innovative social changes through design and building a bridge between people and possibilities. When I am not designing, I enjoy drawing, taking photos, listening to music, and petting cats & dogs.

node.name: Enoch Chen
node.about: Hey, I'm Enoch! Crazy ideas pop into my mind sometimes, and I love making them a reality. I am passionate about my projects, but otherwise I'm a pretty chill dude. You can catch me listening to music, taking things apart, or contemplating life.

node.name: Will Spencer
node.about: Hey! I'm Will, a sophomore developer on DTI, and I love to spend my time coding and helping out the community. Besides DTI, I am involved with Girls Who Code on campus, where I help high-school students learn and appreciate the basics of programming. Besides developing, I spend my time gaming and following politics, so I can commonly be found yelling at my computer due to a broken controller or some scandalous news story.

node.name: Vanessa Wang
node.about: Hi! I'm a junior studying computer science and minoring in electrical and computer engineering. Being on DTI has shown me how much of a positive impact I can make on the community using technology. You can find me practicing my photography skills, meal prepping for the week, helping out the Cornell Origami Club, or crocheting away at home.

node.name: Vladia Trinh
node.about: Hi! I’m Vladia. I am an Operations Research major with a minor in Computer Science. On DTI, I hope to make a positive impact on Cornell and its surrounding community through engineering. Here, I’m also a member of Alpha Phi Omega, and tutor middle schoolers in Ithaca. I love to travel and explore new places almost as much as I enjoy staying home and drinking hot tea. In my free time, you can catch me watching Grey’s Anatomy, getting Korean food in collegetown, or face-timing my dog.

node.name: Vivian Shiu
node.about: I'm ABC: American-Brazilian-Chinese and a designer. I'm passionate about the unaware effects design can have on a person's life. Outside of school you can find me drinking an açai smoothie or petting dogs around campus. I love to play soccer, piano, doodle, and nap!

node.name: Sam Zhou
node.about: I am a full stack web developer with extensive experience in backend development in Kotlin/Java/NodeJS and frontend development with React/Angular Framework. I am interested in designing and developing extensible and scalable software systems as well as programming languages.

node.name: Tony Yang
node.about: I'm a freshmen studying Computer Science at Cornell. I enjoy making mobile apps that impact the community. My friends say that I walk really fast and have coined the term "The Tony Stride". During my free time I enjoy playing basketball, practicing guitar, and watching TV shows.

node.name: Theresa Cho
node.about: Hi there! I'm Theresa, a developer on CoursePlan. In my free time, I enjoy singing, sharing memes, and watching kdramas and cool movies (the whole range from superhero blockbusters to awesome thrillers like Get Out). Also, I am interested in creating tech for social good and recently participated in the 2020 Impact Fellowship! Wherever I am and in whatever I do, I hope to bring about a positive change and make some great friends along the way!

node.name: Chris Tae Seo Lee
node.about: I'm a product designer who's interested in bridging between physical experience and the digital world by creating products. I love DTI design critique sessions and talking to designers to get more insights about design. Other than design, I love listening to music and painting.

node.name: Shi Chong Zhao
node.about: Hi, I am Shi Chong and I am a sophomore majoring in Computer Science and minoring in Cognitive Science in CAS. I am also currently the TPM of eve in DTI. I have been on DTI for three semesters and I have to say that I love the people and the experience here! Also, I am from Singapore and I greatly miss the food back home.

node.name: Shane Yun
node.about: I am a designer for Courseplan. I started off as a designer for CUE. I like UX and mangoes. I am always open to learn more about design and mangoes.

node.name: Sophia Wang
node.about: Hi, I'm Sophia! I am a Senior studying Information Science in Arts. In my free time, I like to run, listen to podcasts, and read up on conspiracy theories. I also enjoy Thai food, EDM, and taking pictures of my dog for his Instagram. :)

node.name: Scott Wang
node.about: Hello! I'm a sophomore studying CS. While my interests are in ML/AI and software development (full-stack & mobile), I am personally fascinated in investigating the connections between technology, deep learning, and education. I enjoy developing video games, playing the cello, and playing Planetside 2 in my free time. Come eat Chicken Udon Stir Fry at Okenshields on Tuesdays with me!

node.name: Stacy Wei
node.about: Hey! I'm currently a junior studying CS. Catch me around campus in all black jamming out to music, exploring campus, or watching dance videos. I have a bit of an addiction to online shopping and donuts. I'm always down for finding new places on campus or discovering new music!

node.name: Sanjana Seshadri
node.about: I'm an aspiring product/UX designer and I hope to make a positive, social impact through the field of design. Besides designing, I love all things music and dance! On campus, I am a member of Cornell Anjali, an Indian classical dance team, and a member of Forté Campus at Cornell, a professional business organization. In my free time, I enjoy exploring new places to eat and drink coffee, finding fun things to take pictures of, and learning how to play my favorite songs on the piano.

node.name: Simran Puri
node.about: Outside of DTI, I continue to use my passion for creating socially impactful technology as part of Cornell Sustainable Design and Spark Design. My other interests include hiking, traveling, watching Grey's Anatomy, and drinking iced coffee.

node.name: Sam Steinberg
node.about: I’m a junior studying Information Science with a concentration in User Experience. I’m a maker at heart, and have always been fascinated with the intersection of design, technology, and business. When I’m not in Duffield doing homework, you can find me hanging out with friends at the gorges, watching sy-fy movies, performing stand-up comedy at open mics, and eating acai bowls at Chatty Cathy.

node.name: Rishitha Thambireddy
node.about: Hi! My name is Rishitha and I am a sophomore studying CS with a minor in Business. Aside from DTI, I am a Rawlings Research Scholar and a part of the E.Motion dance group on campus. I enjoy exploring Ithaca, traveling, and baking in my spare time.

node.name: Rodrigo "Roddy" Taipe
node.about: I consider myself an aspiring web developer since I am still constantly learning about the web development, but I am also interested in other areas of CS including embedded systems and data science. I am currently working for Cosmoptera, a startup based in Ithaca trying to disrupt the precision viticulture market.

node.name: Rose Zhou
node.about: Hi! I'm a Computer Science sophomore minoring in Cognitive Science and Game Design. Aside from my work in DTI, I work on research that applies unsupervised learning to the development of common-sense reasoning in humans. I also volunteer at ACSU and Esports at Cornell's events. In every activity I do on campus, I love learning about other people and welcoming new students! My goals at Cornell are to learn more about the psychology of gaming and technology, to grow as a person, and to have fun! When I have time to burn, I'm playing video games, skiing, and making memes.

node.name: Rebecca Fu
node.about: Hi, I'm Rebecca! I'm currently a junior studying Applied Economics and Management. I joined DTI because INFO 1300 changed my life. But other than that, you can catch me making bad jokes and spending way too much on smoothies at Mac's cafe.

node.name: Bobby Villaluz
node.about: Hey! I am a junior studying computer science. I'm passionate about cybersecurity and developing software for positive community impact. When I'm not in the stacks, I love to surf, read, hike and play ping pong.

node.name: Trey Burrell
node.about: Hey!  I'm Trey and when my software developer hat is off, I'm either an entrepreneur, music producer, or gamer.  I currently serve on the Executive Board for BET, LINK, and SWAG.  You can either catch me in the Engineering Quad doing work, the DPE Office greeting visitors, or the eHub working on one of my businesses.  Thanks for reading!

node.name: Peter Wu
node.about: I'm a freshman computer science major—unexpected, right?—and I'm addicted to the feeling when something you made works. I really like making things that people use, usually on the web. When not working on problem sets and developing for DTI, you'll find me at Helen Newman playing badminton with Cornell's club team, cooking and eating, or listening to all kinds of music.

node.name: Pinxuan Huang
node.about: I am a creator who enjoys building projects across different mediums: programming, digital art, video games, and even food. Presently, I devote my time into being productive, whether it be learning interesting concepts, picking up a new skill, or collaborating with others.

node.name: Neha Bhimesh Rao
node.about: I love to stay busy on campus! Other than being a part of this amazing project team, I'm Co-President of Cornell's Original Musical Theatre Troupe, Anything Goes. In my free time, I enjoy singing, playing guitar, going to rock climbing, watching Netflix, and eating ice cream!

node.name: Matt Zhao
node.about: I'm currently a sophomore in AEM concentrating in Finance and Business Analytics. In the future, I hope to enter either the consulting or sports analytics field. Besides DTI, I am involved in Cornell Economics Society, Men's Club Volleyball, and Lambdas! On any day, you can probably find me procrastinating in eHub or not following my gym schedule.

node.name: Megan Yin
node.about: Hey! I'm Megan. I'm a CS student at Cornell with a minor in ORIE. I love creating user interfaces, analyzing data, and exploring the bleeding edge of web technologies. When I'm not working on stuff for DTI or trying to keep my GPA afloat, you can probably find me scrolling through relatable comics on Instagram, making memes, or just pondering the meaning of life (no the answer is not 42).

node.name: Michael Xing
node.about: Michael is a full stack developer who enjoys building things for people to use. He primarily works in Java and web technologies, but dabbles with anything and everything that looks remotely interesting. When not coding, he enjoys helping aspiring developers while TA'ing 2110 / 2112, playing the piano, or playing video games (not necessarily in that order).

node.name: Megan She
node.about: I'm a senior English major, but I identify as the ampersand in Arts & Sciences. I love working an espresso bar, making far too many Spotify playlists, and dabbling in the intricacies of colloquial language. I'm also a member of Cornell Mars Rover and Science Olympiad at Cornell. I'm always looking for more niche academia, another stamp in my passport, and the best brie out there. And I'm always a sucker for bad jokes.

node.name: Matthew Guo
node.about: I'm currently a sophomore in A&S studying Computer Science, minoring in Information Science (UX Design), and developing for DTI. Aside from programming, I enjoy listening to and making music, pretty much anything related to food, and watching lots of movies.

node.name: Matthew Epstein
node.about: I am a Junior studying Computer Science with an interest in how computers shape how we perceive and interact with our environments. Obsessed with product, learning Figma, and on a quest to eventually understand how backend works. I love YouTube, learning about recent companies' decisions, and lists of three or more. Green is my favorite color, but think blue is an objectively better color. When I'm not studying or taking *way* too many credits, you can find me at Pokelava, with my friends or sleeping (in class or otherwise).

node.name: Laura Sizemore
node.about: I am a junior studying Computer Science in the College of Engineering and am minoring in Public Policy. I enjoy using technology to cause a positive impact in my community and beyond. In addition to software development and technical project management, I have experience in full-stack development and data analysis. When I'm not coding, I enjoy reading sci-fi and fantasy novels, playing both board and video games, going to the gym, and spending time with friends.

node.name: Megan Chang
node.about: Hi! My name is Megan, and I'm a sophomore majoring in Information Science in the College of Arts and Sciences. I'm originally from southern California and when I'm not designing, you can find me taking photos, scrolling through TikTok, drinking way too much chai, or spending time outside.

node.name: Luis Rafael Hoderlein
node.about: I'm a Freshman in A&S studying Computer Science and Statistics. I'm fascinated by anything involving computers. When not programming, I like to read about space and history.

node.name: Lucy Wang
node.about: Hi! My name is Lucy and I am a sophomore studying Information Science. I am passionate about using technology to create social impact, and am excited to work on projects with so many cool people that all share the same interests! On campus I am involved with APO and ISSA, and you can always find me in Olin, probably with an iced coffee (rip my BRBs).

node.name: Katherine Tracy Go
node.about: Hi, I’m Katie! I’m a sophomore from Manila, Philippines studying Information Science. On campus I’m involved with Cornell Creatives, WICC, and Forté. I make YouTube videos every week on my channel, alohakatiex, and I love kimbap and fangirling over YA novels.

node.name: Kaushik Ravikumar
node.about: I'm an avid developer who loves seeing software used to solve problems in the world. I'm also intrigued by the idea of Smart Cities and using the Internet of Things to improve our current infrastructures. I've previously worked at BuzzFeed and PubNub as a SWE. Besides that I love exploring nature, doing pretty much anything spontaneous, traveling, listening to music and dropping my own fire mixtapes on Souncloud.

node.name: Aram Baghdassarian
node.about: Gosh, I feel like these always come off as so generic and cliche and have always wondered what I can do to make them seem less trite. Do people even read these? I'm genuinely curious, so if you're reading this then click http://bit.ly/yes-i-actually-read-the-bio.

node.name: Kinjal Jasani
node.about: I am a sophomore studying electrical and computer engineering with a minor in biomedical engineering. I love making technology that can create a positive impact! That's why over the summer, I created an iOS app called Motivation Monday. It's a social media app focused on positivity by showing each user posts that motivate them specifically, and allows users to post inspirational things! You can find it on the app store now! Besides academics, I love to play video games, watch Netflix, listen to pop music, and explore the best restaurants and attractions in Ithaca!

node.name: Nina Xie
node.about: Passionate about interdisciplinary topics that combine tech, business, psych, and more, I aspire to solve real-world problems using technology as a PM. I’m also a foodie, musician, runner, movie addict, and roller coaster lover.

node.name: Jessie Wong
node.about: I am a freshman majoring in Computer Science in the college of Arts and Sciences. Currently I'm on the Carriage team learning how to Flutter. Catch me on campus wearing free tech t-shirts, listening to NIKI, or stroking my fake beard over a bug.

node.name: Jason Tung
node.about: Invite me to coffee to talk about philosophy!

node.name: Jing Wen Soh
node.about: Hi! I'm Jing, a freshman studying Applied Economics and Management. Aside from DTI, I am also a member of the Cornell Undergraduate Asia Business Society and student representative for the Singapore Students’ Association. I’m interested in all things technology and strategy, and how organisations can work to raise the triple bottom line. Catch me honing my foosball skills at Okenshields, playing badminton or watching Masterchef while drinking copious amounts of bubble tea!

node.name: Julian Londono
node.about: Productivity is a lifestyle: when I'm not working with my team on CU Reviews you'll find me working on Info Sci research, exploring curiosity-driven side projects, mountain biking, or playing soccer. I'm always trying to expand my technical knowledge and skill sets as well as explore more of the world whenever possible. Fun fact: I took a road-trip from New Jersey to California and back this past summer and it was a blast!

node.name: Ji Eun Lee
node.about: Hey! My name is Joanne Lee. I am an ex-fashion designer, now a Product Designer. I've had some cool opportunities working with various stakeholders from all around the world- Costa Rica, Albania, and much more. When I design, EDM or House Music really helps me get in the zone. If you ever need me, you could probably find me in Olin first floor!

node.name: Jessica Chen
node.about: I love exploring/developing ways that technology can contribute to community impact. Aside from CDTI, I am also the philanthropy chair for Alpha Omega Epsilon (Cornell's engineering sorority), a member of the club tennis team, an AEW facilitator, and a Cornell Engineering Ambassador! In my free time, I enjoy hiking, hammocking, adventuring, eating, and chasing sunsets.

node.name: Jalil Evans
node.about: I'm Jalil, a junior in CALS studying Information Science. I'm passionate about bringing ideas to life through design. I'm co-founder and Chief Design Officer of Bloom, a peer-to-peer connection platform for college students. On campus, I'm very involved in the dance scene - I am a dancer for Assorted Aces and BreakFree HipHop.

node.name: Jagger Brulato
node.about: I'm Jagger, a junior majoring in CS. I like to write and produce funk-fusion music, and I do lots of board sports (wakeboarding, wakesurfing, kitesurfing, snowboarding, longboarding, etc.). I also play a lot of Chess and Tetris.

node.name: Jordan Epstein
node.about: I am a sophomore from New York City.  I'm a backend developer for DTI, but aside from that I like comedy movies, video games, and sports (Jets are having a rough year right now).  I regularly smack kids in Fifa, or 2K, and you can always find me late at night watching Family Guy.

node.name: Ishika Jain
node.about: I am currently a sophomore majoring in computer science and economics in the College of Arts and Sciences. In my free time, you can find me performing as part of Cornell’s Indian Classical Dance group, Cornell Nazaqat, cooking or watching one of the many TV shows on ABC. I am excited to explore the design and development side of applications. I am always Down to Integrate (DTI) design and development to create applications that help to add to the Big Red experience!

node.name: Han Wang
node.about: No one ever reads these. If you show my bio to me (that you actually found for the first time from the website), I will buy you boba.

node.name: Helen Yang
node.about: Hey, I'm Helen! I'm a freshman CS major hoping to learn about app+web dev and assistive technology. Outside of DTI, I'm also part of Science Olympiad, which I competed in while in high school. When I'm not crying about CS, you can find me playing Minesweeper and Tetris, binge-watching Bon Appetit videos, or jamming out to music ranging from classical to chiptune!

node.name: Hanwen (Hank) Lin
node.about: Hi! I am a product/UX designer for Eve, and currently a freshman majoring in Information Science with a concentration in UX Design. As a newbie to DTI and UX, I am striving to build a strong design portfolio, while learn from and serve the community with my teammates. Outside of academics, I enjoy playing the piano, composing, soccer, surfing, and traveling!

node.name: Gary Zhuge
node.about: I am currently a junior studying CS and minoring in English. I procrastinate by rewatching movie trailers and reading short stories about warm, faraway places.

node.name: Guanqun Wu
node.about: Hi I'm Guanqun and you can call me Guan. In my spare time, I like playing video games (Fire Emblem :D), eating food or taking photos of chipmunks (when they're out and about on campus). In my time at Cornell I've worked on a lot of random projects, like a pong game controlled by joysticks and a piano game with physical buttons.

node.name: Flora Liu
node.about: Hi, I'm Flora! I am currently studying Information Science in CAS, with concentrations in UI/UX and Digital Culture and Production. In my free time you can find me binging Tasty videos, drinking boba, or traveling (I've been to every single Disney in the world!).

node.name: Evan Welsh
node.about: About Me!

node.name: Ehi Esemuze
node.about: Hi! My name is Ehi and I’m a first-year studying electrical and computer engineering. I am passionate about using design across mediums to create technology that is functional, accessible, sustainable, beautiful, and makes positive social impact. Outside of academic and project team work, you can find me acting in a show, attempting to pick up a new language, listening to music, or reading/writing poetry or prose. Feel free to reach out to me and start a conversation!

node.name: Emily Reynolds
node.about: I am a junior double majoring in information science and computer science (because I just love to make my life more difficult..). You can find me in the library or around campus, but I'll probably accidentally ignore you because I like to blast my music in my earphones and stare into space. You will definitely not find me at a gym, sorry.

node.name: Erin Chen
node.about: I'm a senior in Arts & Sciences studying Information Science. I'm most passionate about the intersection of design and healthcare. Talk to me about all sorts of design, cooking, plants, or music.

node.name: Ein Chang
node.about: Hi, I’m Ein!! I’m a sophomore CS major and excited to be a part of a team where I can work with others from all different backgrounds to create an impactful product! 🤩On campus, I’m also involved in APO and SWE. I love going hiking, to concerts, and am always down to eat some tacos!!

node.name: Emily Chan
node.about: Hello! I'm Emily and I'm a product designer, nature lover, and meme enthusiast. When I'm not hanging out in Duffield or designing something with too many gradients, catch me rock climbing, hiking, cooking, playing guitar, or looking at cute otters on Instagram.

node.name: Elizabeth Mieczkowski
node.about: Hi, I’m Beth! I study CS and psychology in Arts & Sciences, and aside from DTI I’m a member of Big Red Thon, WICC, and Alpha Chi Omega on campus. In my free time, I enjoy reading, visiting art museums, and running. I love solving complex problems with creative solutions, especially when they have a social impact.

node.name: Christopher Hansen
node.about: I am a sophomore in the College of Arts and Sciences studying Computer Science. I collect books and love reading them. I'm also a member of Cornell Hacking Club. I enjoy trying new things!

node.name: Connie Lei
node.about: I am a sophomore majoring in computer science and possibly minoring in linguistics! I love being able to understand where, why and how bugs happen. One of my passions is helping programs like GWC or KWK and having a hand in helping the next generation of girls in computer science!

node.name: Changyuan Lin
node.about: Helloooooooo thanks for clicking on me and reading my blurb. DTI is cool. Generic description of my hobbies and academic interests. If anyone reads this you should let me know

node.name: Dray Farley
node.about: I love working on software that solves real problems, whether it be on campus, in the fitness industry, or in social impact. I primarily work on back-end but love to explore new frameworks and tech stacks! Outside of tech, I am an RA on north campus and a huge (unfortunately) New York Knicks fan. I also enjoy reading and going to the gym in my free time.

node.name: Cedric Castillo
node.about: Hey, I'm Cedric and I'm a senior information science major. I joined DTI as a designer on cue, our events app, sophomore year. Fast forward to the end of junior year, I was given the privilege of joining the leads team to head our design initiatives. Over the past two summers, I've spent my time at a startup designing for growth at Concord, a contract success platform, and understanding how marketing teams utilize data visualizations as part of Facebook's connectivity branch. My moodboard consists of (and is pretty much limited to) ordering oat lattes, shopping at uniqlo, and pretending to listen to music on my airpods.

node.name: Bahar Tehranipoor
node.about: Hi! I'm a freshman majoring in computer science interested in digital humanities and using technology to make an impact internationally. I'm also the webmaster of my acapella group The Touchtones and if I can make the time, I tutor online making educational videos - think Khan Academy!

node.name: Bryan Graeser
node.about: I love working on projects at the intersection of technology and social impact, projects that bring about significant, verifiable positive change to the world. When I'm not nose-deep in a project you can find me writing a short story or squeezing in some extra reps at the Teagle gym.

node.name: Bryant Lee
node.about: I am a developer excited to use my skills to make a positive impact on the community. I primarily do back-end development, with an emphasis on data science, but I do have familiarity with some front-end technologies if needed. Outside of DTI, I am a part of the data engineering subteam under Cornell Data Science, where we tackle difficult problems through data engineering techniques. I am also a Project Manager for Hack4Impact, a group where we develop software for social impact. Additionally, I am a course consultant for CS 2024, C++. In my free time, I enjoy playing games, hanging out with friends, and further developing a homebrew Gameboy game I made.

node.name: Bryan Tabor
node.about: I'm a freshman majoring in Computer Science. I'm interested in computer graphics and game development. In my free time, I like playing Tetris and rhythm games.

node.name: Brandon Hong
node.about: Hi! My name is Brandon Hong, and I am a sophomore in the Hotel School, also pursuing a minor in computer science. On campus, I am involved in Cornell Hotel Society, and I also work part-time in the Johnson payroll office. Outside of school, I enjoy following football (Go Niners!), cooking, watching Gordon Ramsay shows, and learning about the latest trends in technology!

node.name: Benjamin Shen
node.about: I am an engineer/developer in the College of Engineering. Outside of the DTI, I sing in the Glee Club and the Chordials. I like to cook, hike, and play tennis in my free time. My favorite junk food is Cheetos and my favorite drink is iced tea.

node.name: Boon Palipatana
node.about: I'm an Information Science Major concentrating in Data Science. I love working with data analytics in addition to web, mobile app, and game development. Outside of class, I spend time watching basketball, running at a reasonable pace, being an RA in the Low Rises, and bonding with the squirrels on campus.

node.name: Aitong Yu
node.about: Hi! I am a Junior majoring in ISST. I was born in China and immigrated to the US when I was 9. Some of my hobbies include watching figure skating competition, films, and collecting postcards. If dialects count as a different language, then I speak a total of 4 languages.

node.name: Ashrita Raman
node.about: Hi, I'm Ashrita! I am a junior majoring in computer science and minoring in music and linguistics. I am passionate about using technology to create a positive social impact at Cornell. When I'm not working with my DTI subteam, you can find me with the Cornell Symphony Orchestra and Cornell Girls who Code. I also teach piano to students through the Cornell Piano Society. Some of my hobbies include listening to 19th century Romantic music, reading Harry Potter, going on a run, and taking pictures of good food.

node.name: Ashley Ticzon
node.about: When I’m not hiking up the slope to get to class, I enjoy singing and playing music. Also, I have a crazy good memory and can remember almost everything down to the smallest detail. And even though I grew up very accustomed to the warm California sunshine, I actually find the winters in Ithaca very enjoyable.

node.name: Adam Masters
node.about: I am a senior College Scholar with a double major in Information Science. My college scholar project is analyzing the ability for Amazon Alexa and other voice assistants to understand users with various accents and vocal traits. After graduation I will be an Associate Product Manager at Yahoo. Last summer, I worked at Facebook as a Product Data Operations Specialist helping to price the overall product improvement of Facebook Portal. I also currently work for Assist, the leading chatbot provider for messaging and voice. On campus, I am a member of Suna Breakfast and Mundial FC. Outside of school I love photography and listening to music.

node.name: Andrew Gao
node.about: I am a sophomore studying computer science in the College of Arts & Sciences. On DTI, I'm an Android developer for Flux, where we're working on bringing more locations to the app as well as improving the underlying code. Outside of DTI, I am also involved in the Milstein Program, and in my free time, I enjoy photography, graphic design, and basketball.

node.name: Ayesha
node.about: Hi! I'm Ayesha and a developer on course plan! I am currently a creative director on thread and a lover of boba. You can either catch me on the slope drawing or in Upson coding and drinking iced coffee.

node.name: Ansh Godha
node.about: Apart from DTI, I'm a teaching assistant. I love to play squash and table tennis in my free time, and I love going out - I'm always down for any social activity! Oh, and I'm A cS maJoR. You didn't see that coming, did you?

node.name: Ashneel Das
node.about: I am a sophomore computer science major in the college of engineering at Cornell. I've been programming since my early days of high school and DTI gives me the perfect opportunity to apply the knowledge I've gained in a way that can help those around me! Outside of school, I have an unhealthy obsession for bubble tea and (fried) chicken. In my free time, I like to explore new music, learn new card games, and catch up on lost sleep.

node.name: Akash Aryal
node.about: Hi! I'm a CS major in the A&S. My main interests are in web dev (laravel, react) and databases/data science. I love creating products that are impactful and creative. In my free time I like to play League of Legends and hang out with friends.

node.name: Kathleen Xu
node.about: I'm a junior double majoring in Information Science and Applied Economics and Management. I'm happiest when I'm creating, whether that be writing a story, knitting a scarf or drawing. I'm currently a part of DTI (obviously), Cornell Ascend, and Shogi Club. When I'm not trying to power through all my work, you can find me drinking boba tea, watching anime, or obsessing over my betta fish.

hero.subheader: We are Cornell Design & Tech Initiative. But individually, we are a talented, diverse group of students from different colleges and countries striving to make a difference in our community.

diversity.description: More than just being inclusive, our team strives to bring as many backgrounds and perspectives together to solve community problems. These statistics come from recruiting across campus and seeking applicants with the best skills and potential for growth on the team. Updated Spring 2019.
